articles.title: Meta‚Äôs $799 Ray-Ban Display is the company‚Äôs first big step from VR to AR

articles.content: At last year's Meta Connect, Mark Zuckerberg focused less on the company's line of Quest VR headsets and more on the "Orion" prototype see-through augmented reality glasses , which he said could launch in some form or another "in the next few years." At the Meta Connect keynote Wednesday evening, though, Zuckerberg announced that the company's Meta Ray-Ban Display AR glasses would be available starting at $799 as soon as Sept. 30. To be sure, Meta's first commercial smartglasses with a built-in

Multiple widely used packages, collectively downloaded more than 2 billion times per week, were compromised via a single maintainer‚Äôs npm account. Malicious versions of debug , chalk , ansi
articles.content: Last week, a significant supply chain attack hit the JavaScript/TypeScript ecosystem through the npm registry. Multiple widely used packages, collectively downloaded more than 2 billion times per week, were compromised via a single maintainer‚Äôs npm account. Malicious versions of debug , chalk , ansi-styles , and 15 other packages were published. The payload focused on stealing cryptocurrency wallets, but the incident underscored a broader, ongoing risk: the open source supply chain is a high-val
articles.author: Dan Barr

articles.title: Meet the GitHub MCP Registry: The fastest way to discover MCP Servers
articles.description: This is your new home base for discovering MCP servers. Learn how we‚Äôre working with the broader community on MCP publication and discovery. The post Meet the GitHub MCP Registry: The fastest way to discover MCP Servers appeared first on The GitHub Blog .
articles.content: If you’ve tried connecting AI agents to your development tools, you know the pain: MCP servers scattered across numerous registries, random repos, buried in community threads — making discovery slow and full of friction without a central place to go. Meanwhile, MCP server creators are worn out from publishing to multiple places and answering the same setup questions again and again. The result is a fractured environment that’s fraught with potential security risks. Today, we&rs

articles.content: The view of Manhattan from Brooklyn Bridge Parks Pier 6 was obscured as New York City was shrouded in smoke on Wednesday, June 7th, 2023. Wildfire smoke is the air quality nightmare of our generation, eating away at previous gains made by cracking down on industrial emissions and tailpipe pollution. articles.content: Artificial intelligence can draw cat pictures and write emails. Now the same technology can compose a working genome. A research team in California says it used AI to propose new genetic codes for viruses‚Äîand managed to get several of these viruses to replicate and kill bacteria. articles.content: When you write a simple for x in something: in Python, there‚Äôs a lot happening behind the scenes. That ‚Äúsomething‚Äù could be a list, a string, a dictionary, or even a file stream. But what exactly makes an object loop-able? The answer: iterables . In this article (Part 1 of a 3-part series), we‚Äôll explore iterables with an easy-to-grasp metaphor the buffet table . We‚Äôll peel back the layers of Python‚Äôs iteration protocol, look at memory details, pitfalls, and real-life use cases. By the end, you‚Äô

articles.title: How weak passwords and other failings led to catastrophic breach of Ascension
articles.description: A deep-dive into Active Directory and how "Kerberoasting" breaks it wide open.
articles.content: Last week, a prominent US senator called on the Federal Trade Commission to investigate Microsoft for cybersecurity negligence over the role it played last year in health giant Ascension's ransomware breach, which caused life-threatening disruptions at 140 hospitals and put the medical records of 5.6 million patients into the hands of the attackers. Lost in the focus on Microsoft was something as, or more, urgent: never-before-revealed details that now invite scrutiny of Ascension‚Äôs own security
articles.author: Dan Goodin

articles.content: Just ahead of the iPhone 17 lineup arriving on Friday, you can pick up Apple's 25W MagSafe charger for a song. articles.content: Hydrogen is sometimes held up as a master key for the energy transition. It can be made using several low-emissions methods and could play a role in cleaning up industries ranging from agriculture and chemicals to aviation and long-distance shipping. This moment is a complicated one for the green fuel, though, as a new report from the International Energy Agency lays out. A number of major projects face cancellations and delays, especially in the US and Europe. The US in particular is seeing a s
